> <OLD>
>
> WHEELIE watched as ASTRA faded away.  Yes, they were built invisible, or at
> least heavily resistant to scanners.  While he could not say how resistant a
> proper Maximal would register her, as his sensors were woefully minimal, he
> could at least tell she was built that way.  Wondering just why someone
> would make an army of such robots and then let them get away.
>
> The chillig thing he could think of is that investing so much effort in and
> then letting them escape without pursuing them..  Had whomever made them
> wanted this or permitted it to happen?
>
> WHEELIE sat back as he finally decided he could only go in. Heading back
> over then indoors as he went towards the chamber where RODIMUS was being
> treated.

OOC: Actually it was the sun doing a slow fade into night, IE it is
setting and the night is coming. :)

<BACK IN CHARACTER>

There was a slight shrug from ASTRA as she watched WHEELIE disappear
down the steps and back inside the structure itself. With a look
around, satisfying herself that she was indeed alone, she layed down,
folding her arms back behind her head and just watched the skies as
the sky continued darkness on its way towards night.

Meanwhile the way for WHEELIE was largely unimpeeded. The guards
standing at the door nodded to him as he entered. The large room was
nearly empty now, evidently UNUS was elsewhere at the moment. A few
figures turned and glanced at WHEELIE as he made his way through, but
none of them paid him much attention.

Moving through the next doors he came back to the room that housed
RODIMUS, one of the nursing staff exiting the room as WHEELIE walked
up, she turned to look at WHEELIE, "Your friend is doing quite well."
She said. "Since he has awakened and the major repair work completed
his healing process has been going rather fast."

The nurse gestured at the door. "We have him on an energon infusion
now, keeping his self repair circuits rarified and powered up. But he
may be looking for a visitor or two now."

(TAG)

Preston
